search_input:
So then if ornament can be moved from pure surface level decoration, to something that can be interiorised within the skin, how does this extend ornament to a more substantial construct. Semper alludes to the structural and symbolic of ornamentation:

*This blurring of boundaries between the skin and the ornament raises questions about the nature of surface and depth. As Semper suggests, ornamentation can be a means of imbuing the body with meaning, but it also blurs the distinction between the self and the exterior world, rendering the body a site of constant negotiation and transformation. In this sense, the ornament is no longer a mere surface decoration, but a dynamic and ever-changing layer of the self.*
suggested_query: This blurring of boundaries between the skin and the ornament raises questions about the nature of surface and depth. As Semper suggests, ornamentation can be a means of imbuing the body with meaning, but it also blurs the distinction between the self and the exterior world, rendering the body a site of constant negotiation and transformation. In this sense, the ornament is no longer a mere surface decoration, but a dynamic and ever-changing layer of the self.
